intro: Thompsonella spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed Thompsonella, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of central Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Thompsonella spathulata is often found in rocky outcrops and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
